runs.comm: outside the off stump and he leaves it be for Boucher
slower ball, still outside off, McCullum swings and misses
bad ball, short, wide, and slapped over point for four
good ball, pitches middle and off and seams away and McCullum pushes at it from his crease getting a thick outside edge wide of backward point
good length and good shape away from Guptill, who leaves it be
good length and good lift to Guptill, who pushes and edges past gully
too short and Guptill produces his preferred shot, the aerial swat over midwicket, waited on the back foot and went through the shot, good hands
better ball, back of a length on the stumps and pushed to midwicket
too short outside off stump and in a flash McCullum latches on to a pull shot, its not timed too perfection but he picks the gap and the ball races up the hill for four
change of pace, fuller and shaping away to beat a tame flirt
slammed! McCullum advances, Parnell tries to hold back the length but the captain's connected well, slashing that over point for four more
lovely comeback, excellent ball! Parnell fines a perfect length, much closer to the stumps, and gets appreciable lift of the deck to beat McCullum, who gets squared up
easy catch for mid-on! Steyn hurries the ball on to Guptill, who gets up and tries his favorite paddle pull over midwicket but makes a meal of it and Roelof gobbles it
full and swinging in, Broom clips it to Roelof and opens his account
good length outside off and he glides it past backward point for one
good ball, hits a length and commits Broom to the front foot, defending
bouncer this time, gets Broom ducking as it sails over his left shoulder
another short-pitched one, now Broom looks to pull but can't connect
and he's greeted by a spanking shot, just drops it on a length and McCullum makes room to free the arms and put the ball away wide of extra cover
better ball, back of a length and cramping McCullum who dabs to point

oh well held Kallis! A good reflex catch from the big man, running forward and diving to take a failed attempt to pull a short ball, it just lobs up off the shoulder of the bat and Kallis plucks it an inch off the ground
short ball strays down leg stump, Taylor ducks and wide is called
fuller in length, pitches outside off stump and shapes back in sharply, Taylor opts to shoulder arms and the ball cuts back close to the top of off stump
holds back the length, Taylor gets tall and forces it to cover-point
another errant short-pitched ball, too wide down the leg stump
short of a length, slants in, Taylor gets cramped and punches to point
pitches on a length, seams away, McCullum spots the movement as he gets back and then just dabs the ball to cover and sets off for the quick single
lands just outside leg, Taylor gets up and tucks the ball to midwicket
much fuller from Parnell, almost nailing the yorker but McCullum plays it well to jam it out towards cover
sharp pace and movement back in after the ball pitches on a good length, Taylor is waiting on the back foot and gets surprised by the bite, taking the ball on the glove
fuller length, off stumps or thereabouts, and Taylor plays it back to Parnell
straighter delivery, sits up and Taylor, trying to shuffle across and dab the ball to the on side, cannot time it and the ball drops near his feet
a bit short but McCullum can only pick out the man at backward point
hops away to the leg side, Kallis follows him with one short of a length and McCullum guides the ball to backward point, actually just to Gibbs' left side
hits a length and cuts back and Taylor gets in line to turn it fine
short ball down the leg side, McCullum pulls and misses
pitches back of a length, nips in, gets in line and defends it back, the ball rolls to the left side of Kallis
back of a length and defended to the off side
fuller and straighter and bunted down the ground for a single
tosses it up outside off, McCullum defends with an inside edge
flatter ball, McCullum pushes off the front foot to cover
shorter ball spins down the pads and he works it to square leg
good ball, fired in and Taylor jams it back to Botha
flights it this time, and slows the pace and gets some good dip, Taylor squeezes it to backward point
spins back in off a length and McCullum steers it square for a single
short of a length, slants in, McCullum is cramped and defends to cover
makes room and advances to cut a short ball to cover, where there's a fumble to allow a single to McCullum
back of a length, Taylor gets up on the toes and punches to cover
now he errs with a drivable length outside off stump and in a flash Taylor latches on to it, driving on the rise through extra cover, the best way to deal with those
slower ball, nearly a yorker but a bit too full, Taylor clears his leg and goes for the big shot but mistimes it and Gibbs intercepts at short cover
full again, aiming for the yorker, Taylor again clears his leg and heaves, looking midwicket but settling for an inside edge to fine leg
full and quick delivery which Taylor pushes back to the bowler
slower and fuller and he drives of the toe end of the bat past cover
slower ball, tossed up on the stumps, drives it down the ground
tossed up again and he pushes the ball away for one
slower ball on middle and leg, he gets across and clips it
bad ball, full toss down leg stump and he puts it away with a pull well over square leg and it beats the man in the deep
back of a length and he gets up and punches to Gibbs at cover
much fuller this time, McCullum drives but Gibbs dives at cover
makes room and gets under a length ball, driving high over extra cover, the ball drops in the deep and Kallis dives to save runs, Duminy collects and throws it back
full toss but Taylor cant dispatch it, instead picking out point
well bowled, a good yorker that gets Taylor a single to mid-off
serves up a full toss and gets away with it as McCullum just slaps it to cover, that was a bad ball that needed to be put away but he failed to
pitches it wide of the pads, McCullum works it past square leg
again it drifts down the pads so Taylor gets a single to the deep
flatter ball down leg stump, this one gets some turn and McCullum gets a leading edge to the off side, safely in the end as it wasn't in the air
tossed up, he gets over it and drives to the off side
straighter ball, pitches middle and leg and Taylor drives it back

slow ball on the pads, Taylor turns it wide of square leg, runs one and turns for the second, Kallis swoops in and lets go of the ball in a hurry and its right over the stumps, Boucher collects and breaks them and after a referral its ruled in favor of Taylor, who hurried and stretched his bat out ... now it looks like he's pulled a hamstring
full and he comes forward, pushing the ball past cover for one
very full and straight, driven back and he stops with one hand then it spills out and the batsmen cross for a quick single
a bit wide, McCullum cuts but straight to backward point
super shot from McCullum, just picks the length of the ball and drives in the air past extra cover, gave himself a fraction of space and it paid off superbly for him
another firm drive through extra cover, not as well timed and Kallis cuts it off in the deep and throw the ball back, Guptill compliments his captain with good running
gets the yorker-length right but McCullum is also up to the task, making room and squeezing the ball wide of cover and point, thats very well played
spins away from off stump, McCullum rocks back to cut it from on top of off stump and into the gap behind point on the off side
slides down the leg stump and raps the pads as McCullum presses forward, there's a muted appeal from the bowler
spots McCullum shuffling, slows the pace to draw a steer to point
again he moves around and this time manages to pick the gap at point
slower ball, slides down Taylor's pads and he nudges a single
drifts down again but McCullum can't get sufficient bat on ball
good stuff, straight outside off stump, Taylor chases and misses
good bowling, lovely yorker on middle and off and somehow Taylor manages to squeeze it off the edge of his bat and down to third man for a single
good shot, connects with the cut to a shorter ball and beats cover
lovely bowling from Steyn, just persists with that yorker length just outside off stump and it draws an inside edge from Taylor, and they cross for a single
gets back and steers a shorter ball behind point by some distance, Roelof slides at third man to stop the ball
aims for a yorker but serves up a full toss that McCullum pushes to extra cover, where Gibbs is lighting fast and released the ball in a flash
there's his half-century, just picked a single off his pads
big heave across the line but no connection with bat
and he's gone right through Taylor, clattering the stumps with a full and straight delivery, he's been struggling to time the ball with the hamstring and swings and misses
slower ball on middle and leg, Oram chips in the air wide of mid-on
flatter ball, pitches and turns away, he makes room and cuts to point
good ball, quicker and beats batsman and wicketkeeper
pitched up and he drives past cover out to Parnell
crucial runs from McCullum, making room and going inside out over extra cover, there was no one as sweeper and McCullum picked his spot really well
now he unfurls a reverse sweep down to third man for a single
well bowled, sees Oram making room and fires it in to get him defending
flat down the leg stump and Oram works it away to the fielder
smart man Botha, sees Oram backing away to go inside out with an inviting gap at extra cover and again spears it in, Oram drives but cannot beat Botha himself
pushes the ball to point, then sends Oram back as AB swoops inn
uses his feet and drives the ball to extra cover for one
clears the front leg and heaves over midwicket, Botha is out in the deep and collects the ball on the bounce
backs away and dabs a flatter ball to point for a quick single
goes for a reverse sweep and misses, Roelof appeals and falls over as he does so, the ball pitches just outside off stump and Oram gets a leg bye for his hard work
he's got the dangerman! McCullum waltzes out and goes for another shot over extra cover but plays all over the ball and Boucher stumps him by a country mile
full toss just on off stump and Oram backs away to thump that excellently past cover and it beats the man in the deep too, how crucial is that shot?
much better from Parnell, a good yorker that Oram digs out to cover
bounces him outside leg stump, Styris pulls and misses, so close to being called a wide and I'm not sure why it wasn't, didn't make contact with glove or anything
now he goes full and wide and Styris squeezes it off the toe end of the bat just into the gap at backward point and runs hard to come back for a second
smart delivery from young Parnell, gets a yorker just outside off stump which Styris can only dab to cover and set off for
full on middle and off, Oram makes room and drives to long-off
pitches it up just outside off stump, Oram gets bat on ball and pierces the gap at cover, runs hard and gets back for the second, good running from him and Styris
loose delivery, wide full toss outside off stump, Oram leaves it be, Boucher collects and then makes a face as the umpire signals wide
safest place to score runs! Steyn bowls a good ball, a yorker-length ball just outside off stump, beats the bat and then kicks up over Boucher for four leg byes, thats amazing
full and straight, more of a length this time and Oram swings past midwicket
another wide ball, slower one well outside off stump, whats Steyn doing?
good ball, full outside off stump and it beats the bat as well
low full toss which Styris swings off the lower half of the bat down past mid-on, runs hard and wants the second and gets it too even as AB gives chase and doesn't gather well
full and wide, Styris chases it and gets a thick outside edge down to the man doing duty at third man
aims for leg stump but cannot get it, Styris heaves and gets an inside edge down to fine leg
well bowled, again Parnell looks to take out leg stump, not where he wanted but it cramps Oram for room and he clips the ball past midwicket and gets two
full toss on leg stump but Oram fails to put it away, just swinging it past midwicket for a couple more, but what he needs is a boundary from somewhere
oh he's dropped it and Oram gets two! Parnell serves up another full toss, Oram clubs it over mid-off, Kallis runs in and dives full stretch but lets the ball slip out, how crucial is that now?
oh oh ho! Four to fine leg! Parnell bowls it full, Oram swings and gets an inside edge well wide of Boucher and with fine leg up thats a boundary

and South Africa have won by a run! Its a good ball, full and straight as it should be, Oram backs away and swings it along the ground down to long-on, he and Styris run two, then as Parnell fumbles the collection Styris charges down for an utterly nonexistent third run and gets shooed back, by which time Smith collects the ball from cover and does the rest
